meta.name: Updates
meta.description: Settings for update notifications and release channel.

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description: Enable/disable updating notifications and downloading/applying updates.

meta.name: Jellyfin
meta.description: Settings for connecting to Jellyfin

username.name: Jellyfin Username
username.description: It is recommended to create a limited admin account for this program.

server.name: Server address
server.description: Jellyfin server address. Can be public, or local for security purposes.

public_server.name: Public address
public_server.description: Publicly accessible Jellyfin address for invite form. Leave blank to reuse the above address.

client.name: Client Name
client.description: The name of the client that will show up in the Jellyfin dashboard.

cache_timeout.name: User cache timeout (minutes)
cache_timeout.description: Timeout of user cache in minutes. Set to 0 to disable.

type.name: Server type
type.description: Note: Emby integration works but is missing some features, such as Password Resets.

substitute_jellyfin_strings.name: Substitute occurrences of "Jellyfin"
substitute_jellyfin_strings.description: Optionally substitute occurrences of "Jellyfin" in the account creation form and emails with this. May result in bad grammar.

meta.name: General
meta.description: Settings related to the UI and program functionality.

language-form.name: Default Form Language
language-form.description: Default Account Form Language. Visit weblate.jfa-go.com if you'd like to translate.

language-admin.name: Default Admin Language
language-admin.description: Default Admin page Language. Settings has not been translated. Visit weblate.jfa-go.com if you'd like to translate.

jellyfin_login.name: Use Jellyfin for authentication
jellyfin_login.description: Enable this to use Jellyfin users instead of the below username and pw.

admin_only.name: Allow admin users only
admin_only.description: Allows only admin users on Jellyfin to access the admin page.

allow_all.name: Allow all users to login
allow_all.description: Allow all Jellyfin users to access jfa-go. Not recommended, add individual users in the Accounts tab instead.

username.name: Web Username
username.description: Username for admin page (Leave blank if using jellyfin_login)

password.name: Web Password
password.description: Password for admin page (Leave blank if using jellyfin_login)

email.name: Admin email address
email.description: Address to send notifications to (Leave blank if using jellyfin_login)

debug.name: Debug logging
debug.description: Enables debug logging and exposes pprof as a route (Don't use in production!)

contact_message.name: Contact message
contact_message.description: Displayed at bottom of all pages except admin

help_message.name: Help message
help_message.value: Enter your details to create an account.
help_message.description: Displayed at top of invite form.

success_message.name: Success message
success_message.value: Your account has been created. Click below to continue to Jellyfin.
success_message.description: Displayed when a user creates an account

url_base.name: Reverse Proxy subfolder
url_base.description: URL base for when running jfa-go with a reverse proxy in a subfolder. include preceding /, e.g "/accounts".

redirect_url.name: Form success redirect URL
redirect_url.description: Set a different URL for the sign-up form to redirect the user to when they've signed up. Default to 'Public Server' or 'Server' in the Jellyfin tab.

auto_redirect.name: Auto redirect on success
auto_redirect.description: Navigate directly to the above URL instead of needing the user to click "Continue".

login_appearance.name: Login screen appearance
login_appearance.description: Appearance of the Admin login screen.

meta.name: Advanced
meta.description: Advanced settings.

log_ips.name: Log IPs accessing Admin Page
log_ips.description: Log IP addresses of admins and admin page requests in console and in activities. See notice below on legality.

log_ips_users.name: Log IPs accessing User Page
log_ips_users.description: Log IP addresses of users in console and in activities. See notice below on legality.

ip_note.name: Logging IPs:
ip_note.description: Logging IP addresses through jfa-go may violate GDPR or other privacy regulations, as IPs are linked to account information. Enable at your own risk.

tls_port.name: TLS Port
tls_port.description: Port to run TLS server on

tls_cert.name: Path to TLS Certificate
tls_cert.description: Path to .crt file. See jfa-go wiki for more info.

tls_key.name: Path to TLS Key file
tls_key.description: Path to .key file. See jfa-go wiki for more info.

auth_retry_count.name: Initial auth retry count
auth_retry_count.description: Number of times to retry initial connection to Jellyfin before failing.

auth_retry_gap.name: Initial auth retry gap (seconds)
auth_retry_gap.description: Duration in seconds to wait between connection retries.

proxy.name: Use Proxy
proxy.description: Whether or not to use a HTTP/SOCKS5 Proxy.

proxy_protocol.name: Proxy Protocol
proxy_protocol.description: Protocol to use for proxy connection.

debug_log_emails.name: Debug Storage Logging: Emails
debug_log_emails.description: Extra debug logging for writes to the database. *: Deletion also includes blanking out major fields, e.g. an email address.

debug_log_discord.name: Debug Storage Logging: Discord
debug_log_discord.description: Extra debug logging for writes to the database. *: Deletion also includes blanking out major fields, e.g. an email address.

debug_log_telegram.name: Debug Storage Logging: Telegram
debug_log_telegram.description: Extra debug logging for writes to the database. *: Deletion also includes blanking out major fields, e.g. an email address.

debug_log_matrix.name: Debug Storage Logging: Matrix
debug_log_matrix.description: Extra debug logging for writes to the database. *: Deletion also includes blanking out major fields, e.g. an email address.

debug_log_invites.name: Debug Storage Logging: Invites
debug_log_invites.description: Extra debug logging for writes to the database. *: Deletion also includes blanking out major fields, e.g. an email address.

debug_log_announcements.name: Debug Storage Logging: Announcements
debug_log_announcements.description: Extra debug logging for writes to the database. *: Deletion also includes blanking out major fields, e.g. an email address.

debug_log_expiries.name: Debug Storage Logging: User Expiries
debug_log_expiries.description: Extra debug logging for writes to the database. *: Deletion also includes blanking out major fields, e.g. an email address.

debug_log_profiles.name: Debug Storage Logging: Profiles
debug_log_profiles.description: Extra debug logging for writes to the database. *: Deletion also includes blanking out major fields, e.g. an email address.

debug_log_custom_content.name: Debug Storage Logging: Custom Message Content
debug_log_custom_content.description: Extra debug logging for writes to the database. *: Deletion also includes blanking out major fields, e.g. an email address.

meta.name: Activity Log
meta.description: Settings for data retention of the activity log.

keep_n_records.name: Number of records to keep
keep_n_records.description: How many of the most recent activities to keep. Set to 0 to disable.

delete_after_days.name: Delete activities older than (days):
delete_after_days.description: If an activity was created this many days ago, it will be deleted. Set to 0 to disable.

meta.name: Captcha
meta.description: Settings related to user creation CAPTCHAs.

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description: Enable a CAPTCHA on the account creation form.

recaptcha.name: Use Google reCAPTCHA
recaptcha.description: More reliable, but requires some setup. See jfa-go wiki for more info.

recaptcha_site_key.name: reCAPTCHA Site Key
recaptcha_site_key.description: Site Key, see jfa-go wiki for how to acquire one.

recaptcha_secret_key.name: reCAPTCHA Secret Key
recaptcha_secret_key.description: Secret Key, see jfa-go wiki for how to acquire one.

recaptcha_hostname.name: Hostname
recaptcha_hostname.description: Public host-name of jfa-go, e.g. "site.com". Don't include any subpaths.

meta.name: User Page/"My Account"
meta.description: The User Page (My Account) allows users to access and modify info directly, such as changing/adding contact methods, seeing their expiry date, sending referrals or changing their password. Password resets can also be initiated from here, given a contact method or username.

jellyfin_login_note.name: Note:
jellyfin_login_note.description: Jellyfin Login must be enabled to use this feature, and password resets with a link must be enabled for self-service.

edit_note.name: Message Cards:
edit_note.description: Click the edit icon next to the "User Page" Setting to add custom Markdown messages that will be shown to the user. Note message cards are not private, little effort is required for anyone to view them.

show_link.name: Show Link on Admin Login page
show_link.description: Whether or not to show a link to the "My Account" page on the admin login screen, to direct lost users.

referrals.name: User Referrals
referrals.description: Users are given their own "invite" to send to others.

referrals_note.name: Using Referrals:
referrals_note.description: Create an invite with your desired settings, then either assign it to a user in the accounts tab, or to a profile in settings.

allow_pwr_username.name: Allow PWR with username
allow_pwr_username.description: Allow users to start a Password Reset by inputting their username.

allow_pwr_email.name: Allow PWR with email address
allow_pwr_email.description: Allow users to start a Password Reset by inputting their email address.

allow_pwr_contact_method.name: Allow PWR with Discord/Telegram/Matrix
allow_pwr_contact_method.description: Allow users to start a Password Reset by inputting their Discord/Telegram/Matrix username/id.

pwr_note.name: PWR Methods
pwr_note.description: Select at least one PWR initiation method. If none are selected, all will be enabled.

meta.name: Password Validation
meta.description: Password validation (minimum length, etc.)

meta.name: Messages/Notifications
meta.description: General settings for emails/messages.

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description: Enable the sending of emails/messages such as password resets, announcements, etc.

date_format.name: Date format
date_format.description: Date format used in emails. Follows datetime.strftime format.

message.name: Help message
message.description: Message displayed at bottom of emails.

edit_note.name: Customize Messages:
edit_note.description: Click the edit icon next to the "Messages/Notifications" Setting to customize the messages sent to users with Markdown.

meta.name: Email
meta.description: General email settings.

language.name: Email Language
language.description: Default email language. Submit a PR on github if you'd like to translate.

no_username.name: Use email addresses as username
no_username.description: Use email address from invite form as username on Jellyfin.

method.name: Email method
method.description: Method of sending email to use.

plaintext.name: Send emails as plain text
plaintext.description: Send emails as plain text instead of HTML.

required.name: Require on sign-up
required.description: Require an email address on sign-up.

require_unique.name: Require unique address
require_unique.description: Disables using the same address on multiple accounts.

meta.name: Mailgun (Email)
meta.description: Mailgun API connection settings

meta.name: SMTP (Email)
meta.description: SMTP Server connection settings.

username.name: Username
username.description: Username for SMTP. Leave blank to user send from address as username.

encryption.name: Encryption Method
encryption.description: Your email provider should provide different ports for each encryption method. Generally 465 for ssl_tls, 587 for starttls.

hello_hostname.name: HELLO Hostname
hello_hostname.description: Hostname sent when sending HELLO to the SMTP server. Some servers don't like the default "localhost" value, such as smtp-relay.gmail.com.

ssl_cert.name: Path to custom SSL certificate
ssl_cert.description: Use if your SMTP server's SSL Certificate is not trusted by the system.

cert_validation.name: Verify certificate
cert_validation.description: Warning, disabling this makes you much more vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks

meta.name: Discord
meta.description: Settings for Discord invites/signup/notifications

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description:
Enable signup verification through Discord and the sending of notifications through it.
See the jfa-go wiki for setting up a bot.

show_on_reg.name: Show on user registration
show_on_reg.description: Allow users to link their Discord on the registration page.

required.name: Require on sign-up
required.description: Require Discord connection on sign-up. See the jfa-go wiki for info on setting this up.

require_unique.name: Require unique user
require_unique.description: Disables using the same user on multiple Jellyfin accounts.

start_command.name: Start command
start_command.description: Command to start the user verification process.

channel.name: Channel to monitor
channel.description: Only listen to commands in specified channel. Leave blank to monitor all.

provide_invite.name: Provide server invite
provide_invite.description: Generate a one-time discord server invite for the account creation form. Required Bot permission "Create instant invite", you may need to re-add the bot to your server after.

invite_channel.name: Invite channel
invite_channel.description: Channel to invite new users to.

apply_role.name: Apply Role on connection
apply_role.description: Add the selected role to a user when they sign up.

language.name: Language
language.description: Default Discord message language. Visit weblate if you'd like to translate.

meta.name: Telegram
meta.description: Settings for Telegram signup/notifications. See the jfa-go wiki for info on setting this up.

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description:
Enable signup verification through Telegram and the sending of notifications through it.
See the jfa-go wiki for setting up a bot.

show_on_reg.name: Show on user registration
show_on_reg.description: Allow users to link their Telegram on the registration page.

require_unique.name: Require unique user
require_unique.description: Disables using the same user on multiple Jellyfin accounts.

language.name: Language
language.description: Default telegram message language. Visit weblate if you'd like to translate.

meta.name: Matrix
meta.description: Settings for Matrix invites/signup/notifications. See the jfa-go wiki for info on setting this up.

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description:
Enable signup verification through Matrix and the sending of notifications through it.
See the jfa-go wiki for setting up a bot.

show_on_reg.name: Show on user registration
show_on_reg.description: Allow users to link their Matrix on the registration page.

require_unique.name: Require unique user
require_unique.description: Disables using the same user on multiple Jellyfin accounts.

language.name: Language
language.description: Default Matrix message language. Visit weblate if you'd like to translate.

encryption.name: End-to-end encryption (experimental)
encryption.description: Enable end-to-end encryption for messages. Very experimental, currently does not support receiving commands (e.g !lang).

meta.name: Password Resets
meta.description: Settings for the password reset handler.

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description: Enable to store provided email addresses, monitor Jellyfin directory for pw-resets, and send reset pins

pwr_note.name: Setup:
pwr_note.description: There are multiple ways password resets can be set up. See the wiki page for more information.

watch_directory.name: Jellyfin directory
watch_directory.description: Path to the folder Jellyfin puts password-reset files.

link_reset.name: Use reset link instead of PIN (Required for Ombi)
link_reset.description: Send users a link to reset their password instead of a PIN. Must be enabled to reset Ombi password at the same time as the Jellyfin password.

set_password.name: Set password through link
set_password.description: Instead of automatically setting the user's password to the PIN, allow them to set a new password through the reset link.

url_base.name: URL Base
url_base.description: Base URL for jfa-go. You can leave this if you have one set in "Invite Emails". This is necessary because using a reverse proxy means the program has no way of knowing the URL itself.

language.name: Default reset link language
language.description: Default language for password reset success screen.

email_text.name: Custom email (plaintext)
email_text.description: Path to custom email in plain text

meta.name: Invite emails
meta.description: Settings for sending invites directly to users.

email_text.name: Custom email (plaintext)
email_text.description: Path to custom email in plain text

url_base.name: URL Base
url_base.description: Base URL for jfa-go. This is necessary because using a reverse proxy means the program has no way of knowing the URL itself.

meta.name: Custom email template
meta.description: Settings for the template used for announcements & custom messages. HTML should include {{ .text }}, Plaintext should include {{ .plaintext }}, and either can have {{ .message }} to include the contact message.

email_html.name: Custom template email (HTML)
email_html.description: Path to custom email HTML template for announcements/custom messages.

email_text.name: Custom template email (plaintext)
email_text.description: Path to custom email text template for announcements/custom messages.

meta.name: Notifications
meta.description: Notification related settings.

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description: Enabling adds optional toggles to invites to notify on expiry and user creation.

expiry_html.name: Expiry email (HTML)
expiry_html.description: Path to expiry notification email HTML.

expiry_text.name: Expiry email (Plaintext)
expiry_text.description: Path to expiry notification email in plaintext.

created_html.name: User created email (HTML)
created_html.description: Path to user creation notification email HTML.

created_text.name: User created email (Plaintext)
created_text.description: Path to user creation notification email in plaintext.

meta.name: Ombi Integration
meta.description: Connect to Ombi to automatically create both Ombi and Jellyfin accounts for new users. You'll need to add a ombi template to an existing User Profile for accounts to be created, which you can do by refreshing then checking Settings > User Profiles. To handle password resets for Ombi & Jellyfin, enable "Use reset link instead of PIN".

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description: Enable to create an Ombi account for new Jellyfin users

api_key.name: API Key
api_key.description: API Key. Get this from the first tab in Ombi settings.

meta.name: Backups
meta.description: Settings for database backups. Press the "Backups" button above to create, download and restore backups.

enabled.name: Scheduled Backups
enabled.description: Enable to generate database backups on a schedule.

path.name: Backup Path
path.description: Path to directory to store backups in. defaults to <data_directory>/backups.

every_n_minutes.name: Backup frequency (Minutes)
every_n_minutes.description: Backup after this many minutes has passed since the last. Resets every restart.

keep_n_backups.name: Number of backups to keep
keep_n_backups.description: Number of most recent backups to keep. Once this is hit, the oldest backup will be deleted before doing a new one.

meta.name: Welcome Message
meta.description: Optionally send a welcome message to new users with the Jellyfin URL and their username.

enabled.name: Enabled
enabled.description: Enable to send welcome emails to new users.

email_text.name: Custom email (plaintext)
email_text.description: Path to custom email in plain text

meta.name: Email confirmation
meta.description: If enabled, a user will be sent an email confirmation link to ensure their password is right before they can make an account.

email_text.name: Custom email (plaintext)
email_text.description: Path to custom email in plain text

meta.name: User Expiry
meta.description: When set on an invite, users will be deleted or disabled a specified amount of time after they create their account.

behaviour.name: Behaviour
behaviour.description: Whether to delete or disable users on expiry.

send_email.name: Send email
send_email.description: Send an email when a user's account expires.

email_text.name: Custom email (plaintext)
email_text.description: Path to custom email in plain text

meta.name: Account Disabling/Enabling
meta.description: Subject/email files for account disabling/enabling emails.

disabled_text.name: Custom disabling email (plaintext)
disabled_text.description: Path to custom email in plain text

enabled_text.name: Custom enabling email (plaintext)
enabled_text.description: Path to custom email in plain text

meta.name: Account Deletion
meta.description: Subject/email files for account deletion emails.

email_text.name: Custom email (plaintext)
email_text.description: Path to custom email in plain text

meta.name: File Storage
meta.description: Optional settings for changing storage locations.

password_resets.name: Password Resets
password_resets.description: Location of stored non-Jellyfin password resets (json).

users.name: User storage
users.description: Stores users temporarily when a user expiry is set.

ombi_template.name: Ombi user template
ombi_template.description: Location of stored Ombi user template.

user_profiles.name: User Profiles
user_profiles.description: Location of stored user profiles (encompasses template and configuration and displayprefs) (json)

html_templates.name: Custom HTML Template Directory
html_templates.description: Path to directory containing custom versions of web ui pages. See wiki for more info.

lang_files.name: Custom language files directory
lang_files.description: The path to a directory which following the same form as the internal 'lang/' directory. See GitHub for more info.

custom_emails.name: Custom email content
custom_emails.description: JSON file generated by program in settings, different from email_html/email_text. See wiki for more info.

custom_user_page_content.name: Custom user page content
custom_user_page_content.description: JSON file generated by program in settings, containing user page messages. See wiki for more info.

telegram_users.name: Telegram users
telegram_users.description: Stores telegram user IDs and language preferences.

matrix_users.name: Matrix users
matrix_users.description: Stores matrix user IDs and language preferences.

matrix_sql.name: Matrix encryption DB
matrix_sql.description: Stores cryptographic material for Matrix end-to-end encryption.

discord_users.name: Discord users
discord_users.description: Stores discord user IDs and language preferences.
